details:
As a software engineer you will work across the stack on the Kapa systems that answer thousands of developer questions per day. Check out Dockerâ€™s documentation for a live example of what kapa is.

In This Role, You Will

Work directly with the founding team and our research engineers.
Scale the infrastructure that powers the Kapa RAG engine (Python).
Experiment with new features in the Kapa analytics platform (React + Python).
Work on the client integrations which are used to deploy Kapa for our customers (React + Python).
Give Kapa access to new kinds of data (Python).
Maintain our React SDK.

You May Be a Good Fit If You Have

A degree in computer science, machine learning, mathematics, statistics or a related field.
3+ years of software engineering experience working on complex systems in both backend and frontend.
An affinity for machine learning, deep learning (including LLMs) and natural language processing.
The ability to work effectively in a fast in a environment where things are sometimes loosely defined.
 This is neither an exhaustive nor necessary set of attributes. Even if none of these apply to you, but you believe you will contribute to kapa.ai, please reach out.

title: Senior Software Engineer (Turkey)
details:
The salary range for this role is $270,000 - $386,000 per month (Gross in TRY) 

About Sezzle:

With a mission to financially empower the next generation, Sezzle is revolutionizing the shopping experience beyond payments, blending cutting-edge tech with seamless, interest-free installment plans that make shopping smarter and more accessible. Weâ€™re not just transforming payments; weâ€™re redefining how people discover, interact with, and purchase the things they love while driving real impact on merchant sales through increased conversions and higher order values. As we continue to shape the future of fintech and retail, weâ€™re building an innovative, dynamic team passionate about creating more than just a transaction but a truly unique shopping journey. If youâ€™re excited about pushing boundaries in tech and delivering a game-changing experience for consumers and merchants alike, come join us at Sezzle and help create the future of shopping!

Compensation:

For this senior development role, with 8+ years of experience, the compensation range is $270,000 - $386,000 per month Gross in TRY. This range acknowledges the extensive expertise, leadership capabilities, and significant contributions expected at this level, offering a competitive salary to reflect the value of advanced skills and experience.

About the Role: 

We are seeking a talented and motivated Senior Software Engineer who is best in class with a high IQ plus a high EQ. This role presents an exciting opportunity to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment within a rapidly growing team, with abundant prospects for career advancement.

As a Senior Software Engineer with Sezzle, you will work with a highly-motivated team to tackle interesting and challenging problems across multiple areas of the organization. Your experience and guidance will help other members of the team level-up their own skills as well.

In this backend focused role, you will work closely with stakeholders from Product, Support and the business. Youâ€™ll also partner with other engineering teams to provide high-quality, scalable, and innovative solutions to internal and customer problems. Your day-to-day responsibilities will include designing, developing, and delivering new features, as well as unblocking and mentoring your teammates.

This role has both an internal and external focus, your contributions will make a meaningful difference in the day-to-day lives of your peers at Sezzle, enhancing their ability to support our business and customers, and you will have opportunities to take any feedback and iterate.

Interview Process

We believe transparency is important at Sezzle. Regularly providing feedback while setting expectations is part of our culture starting with the interview process. Advancement through each step is not guaranteed.

Application submitted (you are here)
Cognitive test (12 min)
Coding assessment (:1.5 hours)
Interview with recruiters (30 min)
Interview with engineers (1 hour)
Interview with engineering leadership (30-45 min)
Offer!

Key Role Responsibilities: 

Design software applications and features in Golang and React
Help build out a distributed architecture, creating solutions that work within it, maintaining consistency while scaling highly
Coordinate with internal company stakeholders to design market winning products
Develop and collect metrics to drive continuous improvement of existing products
Deliver high quality features which can be tested and adheres to reporting standards
As needed, lead small development teams to bring a project to market
Mentor other engineering teammates to help elevate their experience and knowledge

Minimum Requirements:

At least 7 years of full-stack software engineering experience
Experience bringing new ideas and building consensus on the path forward
Experience with building and serving REST APIs using Go and Java Python or a similar language.
Experience working in a distributed, cloud-based architecture, with either design patterns like transactional outboxes, or queuing tools like RabbitMQ, SQS, Kafka
BS in Computer Science or similar degree, or equivalent work experience.

Preferred Knowledge and Skills:

Experience with SQL based RDMS through an ORM tool
Comfortable using observability platforms like Prometheus, or vendor solutions like NewRelic or Datadog to instrument your code for production monitoring and alerting.
DevOps experience with CI/CD pipelines
Familiarity with containerized micro-service architecture deployed with Kubernetes on AWS
Demonstrated history of delivering commercial APIs and web applications
A clear record of getting products to market and prioritizing solutions and improvements based on stakeholder/customer feedback.

About You: 

You have relentlessly high standards - many people may think your standards are unreasonably high. You are continually raising the bar and driving those around you to deliver great results. You make sure that defects do not get sent down the line and that problems are fixed so they stay fixed.
Youâ€™re not bound by convention - your successâ€”and much of the funâ€”lies in developing new ways to do things
You need action - speed matters in business. Many decisions and actions are reversible and do not need extensive study. We value calculated risk-taking.
You earn trust - you listen attentively, speak candidly, and treat others respectfully.
You have backbone; disagree, then commit - you can respectfully challenge decisions when you disagree, even when doing so is uncomfortable or exhausting. You have conviction and are tenacious. You do not compromise for the sake of social cohesion. Once a decision is determined, you commit wholly.
You deliver results - you focus on the key inputs and deliver them with the right quality and in a timely fashion. Despite setbacks, you rise to the occasion and never settle.

Sezzleâ€™s Technology Stack:

Languages: Golang, Typescript, Python
Frontend: Typescript - React and React Native
Backend: Golang
Database: MySQL, Postgres, Elasticsearch
DevOps & Cloud: AWS, Kubernetes
Version Control: Git
CI/CD: Gitlab
Testing: Developer-driven, focus on automated unit, integration, and end-to-end tests
Sezzle is focused on using open source, and we build what we can before buying!

What Makes Working at Sezzle Awesome? 

At Sezzle, we are more than just brilliant engineers, passionate data enthusiasts, out-of-the-box thinkers, and determined innovators; we are skilled musicians, yogis, cyclists, chefs, golfers, dog-lovers, and rock-climbers. We believe in surrounding ourselves with not only the best and the brightest individuals, but those that are unique and purpose-driven in all that they do. Our culture is not defined by a certain set of perks designed to give the illusion of the traditional startup culture, but rather, it is the visible example living in every employee that we hire.

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer (.NET & Vue/React) - WEST
details:
Top 3 Reasons To Join Us

Competitive Salary
International Environment
Working on the latest tech for the Insurtech Market Leader


About Us

At CoverGo, our mission is to empower all insurance companies to make insurance 100% digital and accessible to everyone.

We are a leading global no-code insurance platform for health, life, and P&C

Experience with container technologies like docker and good understanding of cloud infrastructure and solutions
Experience with agile development methodologies and collaborating with cross-functional teams
Excellent problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to troubleshooting and bug fixing
Strong communication skills to effectively interact with both technical and non-technical team members with diverse backgrounds
A passion for staying updated with the latest trends, technologies, and best practices in software development


Why You'll Love Working Here

Competitive renumeration package
International Environment
Hybrid work mode for those in Ho Chi Minh City; Remote for those outside Ho Chi Minh City
15 days annual leave
13th-Month Pay
Annual Performance Bonus
Stock Options after 6 months
Company activities and events
Learning and development plan


CoverGo Company Video

By submitting your application, you confirm that you have read, understood, and accepted the content of CoverGo's Privacy Notice and you consent to the processing of your data as part of this application.

title: Lead Software Engineer
details:
AppNation was founded in 2021 with a mission to develop world-class, AI-powered mobile applications that make a lasting impact on millions of users. We are the creators of Genie, Fotorama, and Arch, delivering innovative solutions that enhance everyday experiences.

Our apps have consistently ranked among the top charts in over 30 countries, reaching more than 50 million users worldwide. Recognized by Apple on the App Store, we continue to push the boundaries of innovation in the mobile tech industry.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at AppNation is a chance to learn, make an impact, and accelerate your career at an exceptional pace. Thatâ€™s our promise.

What Youâ€™ll Do

Lead and Mentor: Guide and mentor a team of software engineers, fostering a culture of continuous learning, innovation, and technical excellence
Develop Across the Stack: Oversee and contribute to both backend and frontend development, ensuring a seamless experience across all layers of the application
Architect Scalable Solutions: Design, develop, and optimize high-performance, scalable applications and systems that power our AI-driven mobile apps
Create and Enhance Web Panels: Build and improve critical web panels, including admin dashboards, automation tools, and marketing analytics platforms
Set the Technical Standard: Define and enforce best practices, ensuring high code quality, security, and maintainability
AI & Data-Driven Systems: Work with AI models, real-time data processing, and scalable architectures to enhance AI-powered mobile experiences
Monitor, Debug, and Improve Reliability: Set up observability tools (Datadog, Prometheus, New Relic) to monitor performance, detect anomalies, and ensure high system uptime. Implement logging and alerting strategies to proactively address issues before they impact users
Optimize Cloud Infrastructure & Security: Ensure cloud infrastructure is secure, scalable, and cost-effective by implementing best practices in IAM, secrets management, and API security. Work with tools like Terraform and Kubernetes to automate infrastructure provisioning and enhance system resilience
Drive Innovation: Stay ahead of emerging technologies, industry trends, and best practices to continuously enhance our tech stack and processes
Collaborate Cross-Functionally: Work closely with product managers, designers, and other teams to translate business requirements into scalable technical solutions
Ensure Code Quality and Reliability: Implement testing strategies, conduct code reviews, and promote best practices in CI/CD workflows



What We Look For

Proven Leadership: You have experience leading a team of engineers, setting technical direction, and mentoring developers
Full-Stack Expertise: Strong proficiency in Node.js, SQL (MySQL/PostgreSQL), and frontend technologies like React, Angular, or Vue
Cloud & Infrastructure Knowledge: Hands-on experience with Google Cloud Services, including Firebase, Compute, Containers, and API Management
System Design & Architecture: Ability to design robust, scalable, and secure system architectures that support millions of users
AI Model Deployment & API Management: Experience in integrating AI models into production environments, optimizing API performance, and managing AI-related infrastructure. Familiarity with AI inference pipelines and efficient model-serving strategies
Code Quality Advocate: You take pride in writing clean, modular, maintainable, and scalable code thatâ€™s easy to extend
Testing & Automation: Experience in unit testing, test automation tools, and CI/CD pipelines
Observability & Monitoring: Familiarity with logging, monitoring, and alerting tools to ensure high system uptime and reliability
Security & Compliance Best Practices: Strong understanding of IAM, secrets management, and API security
Problem-Solving Focused: Ability to break down complex problems, propose solutions, and drive decision-making
Communication & Collaboration: You can articulate complex technical concepts clearly and work effectively across teams
Agile Mindset: Comfortable working in fast-paced, iterative development cycles with an emphasis on continuous improvement
Fluent in English: Strong verbal and written communication skills for technical discussions and collaboration



What We Offer

Work with exceptional people. At AppNation, youâ€™ll collaborate with small, autonomous, results-driven teams alongside some of the most talented minds in the mobile app industry
A platform for growth. We go above and beyond to hire individuals with extraordinary potential and provide them with the opportunities, resources, and challenges to thrive. At AppNation, young professionals often take on leadership roles in projects that reach millions of users. If youâ€™ve got the drive, youâ€™ll quickly find yourself playing a pivotal role in shaping our success
Competitive compensation. We offer salaries that are above the standard for our sector, ensuring that youâ€™re rewarded fairly for your skills, dedication, and impact. Compensation grows rapidly as you contribute more to the teamâ€™s success, ensuring your financial growth matches your career progress
Unmatched benefits. Work-from-home Wednesdays, access to learning materials, premium private health insurance, meal and commute compensation, comprehensive relocation support, and even a day off to celebrate your birthday. Weâ€™re dedicated to creating an environment where you can do your best workâ€”and enjoy the journey



The Recruitment Process

Weâ€™ve designed a rigorous yet rewarding process to find the best fit for both you and our team:


 Application Review: Weâ€™ll carefully assess your CV and experience
 First Interview: A 30-minute online interview with our People & Culture team to discuss your background, goals, and alignment with our mission
 Case Study: A practical assignment to demonstrate your expertise and problem-solving skills
 Technical Interview: A deep dive with our team lead, focusing on technical topics and assessing your knowledge
 Team Interview: Meet with the founders to discuss your vision, aspirations, and how we can grow together
 CEO Interview: A one-on-one conversation with our CEO to discuss alignment on vision, culture, and long-term goals
 Final Decision: Weâ€™ll get back to you within a few days with our decision



Before You Apply

At AppNation, we set ambitious goals and demand the best from ourselves and each other. This creates a fast-paced, challenging environment that offers unparalleled opportunities for growth, achievement, and learning.

We value passion, potential, and a willingness to grow. If this role excites you and you believe you have what it takes, we encourage you to applyâ€”even if you donâ€™t check every box.

title: Sr. React Native Developer
details:
At HubX we build mobile apps, used and loved by millions all around the world.

We have a track record of building and growing mobile apps on various verticals that reached over 200 million users across 6 continents and 170+ countries.

We are looking for a talented â€œSr. React Native Developerâ€ to join our energetic and highly motivated team.

As a talented â€œSr. React Native Developerâ€, you have plenty of opportunities at your fingertips. So, why should HubX be your next move?

We offer you an opportunity to make a huge impact in the lives of millions of users through our products, and even the mobile app industry at large in the next years to come.

X Culture: Do What You Love

At HubX, we pride ourselves on fostering an environment of collaboration, creativity, and innovation. Our #XCulture is more than just a workplace ethos; it's a lifestyle. We believe passion drives success. At HubX, Do What You Love isnâ€™t just a motto; it's the foundation of our work.

Some Of Your Responsibilities

Create beautiful, pixel-perfect UIs across both mobile platforms that look and feel native.
Leverage native APIs for deep integrations with both platforms.
Work alongside our product owner and UI/UX designers to realize your shared vision.
Write automated tests that give us the confidence to iterate quickly and ensure the product is of the highest quality
Diagnose and fix bugs and performance bottlenecks
Engage with the React Native community to report, request, and help implement critical software fixes
Maintain a stable and current-when-possible React Native create an environment for our CI pipeline
Stay current on the latest platform capabilities so that we know whats possible
Practice Scrum with a great group of developers and product managers

What We Look For

5+ years experience in mobile application development 
Strong proficiency in TypeScript and modern JavaScript (ES6+), including advanced concepts like closures, context, and asynchronous patterns.
Deep understanding of mobile architecture, component patterns, and rendering lifecycles in React Native.
Experience integrating and debugging In-App Purchase systems on iOS and Android (StoreKit, Google Play Billing).
Demonstrated experience with CI/CD systems, ideally using GitHub Actions, EAS, CircleCI.
Solid understanding of mobile performance optimization and profiling tools (Flipper, Hermes, etc.).
Experience consuming RESTful APIs and working with tools like Axios, React Query, or RTK Query.
Strong knowledge of automated testing frameworks (e.g., Jest, Detox, Testing Library).
Practical experience with Agile/Scrum, sprint planning, retrospectives, and cross-functional collaboration.
Excellent problem-solving skills, ownership mindset, and a drive for continuous improvement.
Ability to write clean, maintainable code with attention to code quality, scalability, and documentation.
Good command of written and spoken English. 

The Perks And Benefits Of Working With Us

We would like you to focus on what you do best, we take care of the rest.

Huge impact: Your work can significantly impact our millions of users, and even the mobile app industry at large in the next years to come.
A competitive compensation package: A competitive compensation package: Our total compensation package is very comprehensive; covering your cost of commuting for our headquarters as well as providing you with a meal card.
A unique and top-notch office: Our Istanbul office is located at Levent, right in the heart of the city. Surrounded by the energy of Istanbulâ€™s bustling core, itâ€™s a space designed for creativity and collaboration.
You can come to our office or work wherever you want. If you choose the on-site option, keep in mind that itâ€™s still fine to sometimes work remotely.
Unlimited coffee from XPresso: You can grab a cup of coffee whenever you needâ€”whether itâ€™s to kickstart your morning or power through the day.
Limitless Snacks & Breakfast: Fuel your day with our fully stocked kitchen! From a hearty breakfast to a variety of snacks available anytime, weâ€™ve got everything you need to stay energized and focused.
Ownership, opportunity to take responsibility from day one: No one will micromanage you. Together with your team, youâ€™ll be free to choose a direction, test, fail, and test the next idea.
Team events that create lasting memories, including our traditional All Hands gatherings where the whole company comes together, as well as more humble celebrations and happy hours. Curious about our vibe? Take a look at our Instagram!
Continuous education: The more you want to improve your knowledge, the more we support you!
Strong company culture: Our approach is always open communication & teamwork. #XCulture
Private Medical Insurance & HPV Vaccine: We go above and beyond for your health.
Gym Reimbursement: We support annual gym membership because we want you to be in tip-top shape psychically and mentally.
X Community Discounts: Being part of HubX comes with perks, enjoy exclusive discounts and more as a valued member of our community.
A brand new Macbook and Welcome Kit

The Recruiting Process

At HubX, we value transparency and efficiency. Hereâ€™s a glimpse into our streamlined recruitment process:

Application Submission: Apply by submitting your CV, LinkedIn profile, or a brief introduction about yourself.
Talent & Culture Interview: Engage in a conversation with our Talent & Culture team to discuss your background, aspirations, and how we align with each otherâ€™s goals.
Case Study Assignment: Showcase your skills through a practical task related to the role.
Technical Interview: Meet with your potential team lead for an in-depth review of your case study and technical expertise.
Welcome Aboard!: If all goes well, weâ€™re excited to extend an offer and welcome you to the team.

Your personal data collected through your job applications will be processed by HubX in accordance with the Personal Data Protection Law No. 6698 ("KVKK") for the recruitment and evaluation. To review our data protection informing text: Link

details:
Main Responsibilities;

Manage the Bankâ€™s FX position with profit maximization and risk management approach in a faced paced environment and volatile market conditions,
Analyze the transactions and rates on the Bankâ€™s FX platform (Digit), compare them with similar platforms in the market, and evaluate feedbacks from users,
Analyze customer behavior to cluster users to optimize spreads,
Comply with regulatory requirements and react swiftly in case of a problem,
Improve Digit in close collaboration with Business units, branches, and customers,
Define and measure KPIs for Digit, determine key financial targets and analyze competitors,
Define, prioritize, and communicate short-, mid-and long-term goals of the product by owning and maintaining a visible product roadmap,
Collaborate with user experience experts, visual designers, and engineers to reach the best possible version of a product,
Create and maintain product backlogs.
Prioritize development activities with engineering teams, assist in determining the best technical implementation methods, work closely with BA on acceptance testing, and lead product launches,
Validate opportunities through research, data analysis, competitive research, and other relevant tools,
Act as the voice of the user and key stakeholders during day-to-day aspects of product development,
Help define and refine working processes in order to maximize efficiency in constantly evolving environments,
Meet frequently with business units, analysts, engineers, and other Digit stakeholders to capture requirements and communicate the progress of new product releases,

The ideal candidate will have;

A minimum of a Bachelor's degree is required, MBA is preferred,
Knowledge in SQL, Python, and/or PowerBI is required,
Have 2+ years of Product Management or Business Analyst experience, having managed at least one entire product development cycle from concept to launch is preferred,

title: Software Engineering Manager
details:
We are a leading leisure airline with a mission to deliver seamless, safe, and efficient travel experiencesâ€”powered by technology. Our in-house IT development team plays a critical role in supporting the internal operational backbone of our airline. As we expand and innovate, weâ€™re looking for a passionate Engineering Manager to join our growing team.

As an Engineering Manager, you will lead a small but highly skilled group of software developers across multiple squads. Youâ€™ll work closely with Business Analysts and Technical Product Owners to deliver high-impact, reliable digital solutions for our internal operations. Youâ€™ll be responsible not just for delivery, but also for mentoring engineers, fostering innovation, and elevating engineering practices across the board.

Key Responsibilities:

Lead, mentor, and support a team of engineers working on mission-critical internal systems.
Establish and uphold team norms and engineering standards , promoting a culture of accountability and excellence.
Contribute to technical discussions and architecture decisions , leveraging your software engineering expertise to guide quality and scalability.
Collaborate with technical product owners and business analysts to align on priorities and deliver solutions that meet real-world operational needs.
Collaborate with stakeholders "to align on priorities, maintain a clear roadmap, and ensure transparency across technical and non-technical teams.
Drive engineering excellence through code quality, automation, performance optimization, and modern DevOps practices.
Champion the adoption of AI-based development tools and innovative technologies to improve team productivity and code quality.
Support career development through coaching, training opportunities, and performance feedback.
Help scale our architecture and development practices as we expand our use of Azure and explore AWS.
Oversee mobile app development initiatives (React Native) alongside backend and cloud projects.


What Weâ€™re Looking For:

Minimum 8 years of working experience.
Bachelor's degree in in Engineering, Management or related fied; masterâ€™s degree preferred.
Proven experience as a software engineering leader or manager, ideally in a high-availability or operational tech environment.
Deep technical expertise â€” comfortable diving into architecture discussions, code reviews, and technical decision making
Strong technical background in.NET Framework, .NET Core, React, Vue,TypeScript and cloud-native development on Azure.
Strong experience with Microsoft SQL Server (T-SQL stored procedures,functions, queries). Knowledge of Oracle PL/SQL.
Experience with RESTful and SOAP Web Services, and GraphQL APIs.
Experience in consuming messages from Azure Event Hub, Kafka.
Exposure to or curiosity about AWS and cross-cloud strategies.
Experience or interest in mobile app development using React Native with Expo is a plus.
A passion for continuous learning, mentoring, and improving engineering culture.
Familiarity with AI-driven developer tools (e.g., GitHub Copilot, CursorAI, CI/CD optimization, automated testing frameworks) is a strong advantage.
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills.

Why Join Us?

Be part of a mission-driven airline at the heart of operational excellence.
Work with modern tech in an environment that values experimentation, innovation, and learning.
Enjoy flexibility, a collaborative culture, and direct impact on systems used by the aviation professionals every day.


SunExpress, as an Equal Opportunity Employer, welcomes all applicants independent of individual differences. We believe that having a diversified talent is our biggest strength. All decisions about our current and potential talent are based solely on criteria that have nothing to do with an applicant's attributes that are irrelevant to job performance; at SunExpress, we only focus on competency, know-how, skills, and experience.


SunExpress is named â€œEurope's Best Leisure Airlineâ€ in 2024 by Skytrax. SunExpress is also awarded the Great Place to Work Certificate in 2023 and 2024 as a result of the employee survey conducted by the research and consulting firm Great Place to WorkÂ®, the global benchmark for identifying and recognizing outstanding employee experience.

title: Engineering Manager - Web
details:
Canonical is a leading provider of open-source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of globally distributed collaboration, with 1100+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder-led, profitable and growing.

We are hiring a Web Engineering Manager to work collaboratively with many teams and roles across the organisation including product managers and other engineering teams to deliver reliable, scalable and delightful user experiences for users of Canonical products.

As an Engineering Manager at Canonical, your primary responsibility is to the people you support: ensuring that they are growing as web engineers, doing valuable work, and generally having a great time at Canonical. As a lead for strong engineers, technical leadership and a solid background in web development is a must so that you're able to challenge and grow your team members. You will have the opportunity to influence the culture, facilitate technical delivery, and work with your team on strategy and execution.

Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.

The role entails

Demonstrate sound engineering principles by directly contributing to your team's goals
Estimate work, set goals, and meet them
Design and implement well-tested and documented software in Web technologies or Flutter.
Debug and fix issues encountered by your users
Participate in our engineering process through code and architectural reviews
Collaborate with community and colleagues on technical specifications
Contribute to technical documentation to make it the best of its kind
Seek improvements to engineering and operations practices
Deploy and operate services developed by the team
Contribute to the success of your product through technical advocacy

What we are looking for in you

You are knowledgeable and passionate about web and software development
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
An exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or STEM, or a compelling narrative about your alternative path
Drive and a track record of going above and beyond expectations
Well-organised, self-starting and able to deliver to schedule

details:

As Decathlon Turkey, aligned with our global mission, we keep on growing with more than 40 stores and online businesses.

In the high-paced dynamic environment of Decathlon Turkey, we are now looking for a Procurement Specialist!

title: Engineering Manager - Web
details:
Canonical is a leading provider of open-source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of globally distributed collaboration, with 1100+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder-led, profitable and growing.

We are hiring a Web Engineering Manager to work collaboratively with many teams and roles across the organisation including product managers and other engineering teams to deliver reliable, scalable and delightful user experiences for users of Canonical products.

As an Engineering Manager at Canonical, your primary responsibility is to the people you support: ensuring that they are growing as web engineers, doing valuable work, and generally having a great time at Canonical. As a lead for strong engineers, technical leadership and a solid background in web development is a must so that you're able to challenge and grow your team members. You will have the opportunity to influence the culture, facilitate technical delivery, and work with your team on strategy and execution.

Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.

The role entails

Demonstrate sound engineering principles by directly contributing to your team's goals
Estimate work, set goals, and meet them
Design and implement well-tested and documented software in Web technologies or Flutter.
Debug and fix issues encountered by your users
Participate in our engineering process through code and architectural reviews
Collaborate with community and colleagues on technical specifications
Contribute to technical documentation to make it the best of its kind
Seek improvements to engineering and operations practices
Deploy and operate services developed by the team
Contribute to the success of your product through technical advocacy

What we are looking for in you

You are knowledgeable and passionate about web and software development
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
An exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or STEM, or a compelling narrative about your alternative path
Drive and a track record of going above and beyond expectations
Well-organised, self-starting and able to deliver to schedule
Professional manner in interacting with colleagues, partners, and community
Experience designing and writing high-quality Web technologies
Experience with and passion for Typescript, React or Flutter
An eye for accessibility and performance
Professional written and spoken English
Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
Passion, thoughtfulness, and self-motivation
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Result-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments
Ability to travel twice a year, for company events for up to two weeks each

Nice-to-have skills

Experience with container tech such as LXD, Docker and Kubernetes
Experience building and maintaining a talented team
REST API design, development and governance
Performance engineering and security experience

What we offer colleagues

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.

Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Maternity and paternity leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long-haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background creates a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Back-End Developer
details:
Medsien is the leading provider of scalable remote care management for a quality patient experience. Hundreds of organizations trust Medsien's unparalleled technology solutions to implement exceptional remote care management programs, personalize every interaction, and improve the lives of the people who need it most. Based in San Francisco and venture-backed by top-tier investors, Medsien was founded to reimagine remote care management.

More than 60% of all U.S. adultsâ€”over 150 million peopleâ€”live with at least one chronic condition, which requires dedicated, ongoing medical support outside the four walls of their doctor's office. And yet, only 20% of these patients have access to remote care from the comfort of their homes, putting their health at significant risk. Together, we can save lives and create a real impact.

Medsien is a venture-backed healthcare SaaS company experiencing rapid growth and looking to expand our team. We are seeking organized, motivated, and passionate Back-End Developers to join our team of talented and inspiring developers in a fast-paced environment.

As a Back-End Developer, you'll work on new exciting projects with full autonomy. We're looking for a candidate who is passionate about building new applications from the ground up and who will join a growing team in developing the products that enable providers to provide high quality services to their patients.

As a Back-End Developer, you will:

Implement and document new software apps and components,
Understand how code fits into broader technical and/or business contexts,
Actively participate in code review and technical design reviews,
Work on medium to large projects. Participate in all system/component implementation and design from development to production,
Research new technologies and prototype new ideas,
Ensure high testability and quality of delivered software,
Work with the Operations team to troubleshoot and fix defects in software,
Participate in building Scrum processes and agile culture within the company.

Please apply if you have:

3+ years of back-end development experience,
Having worked in a dynamic, agile environment with minimal supervision,
Extensive experience with Python/Django,
A creative and driven mindset with experience navigating through ambiguity and a desire to work in a fast-paced, results-driven environment,
A desire to learn and try new approaches/ ideas and stretch boundaries,
Extreme problem solving skills,
Superb communication skills,
Bachelor's Degree or higher in Computer Science, or a related field of study,
Perfect English skills; both written and oral,
Accomodation in Istanbul city center.

For this position, we offer:

competitive USD salary and stock options,
Flexible vacation and PTO policies,
Fully remote work opportunities, 
Training, mentorship, and coaching from leadership. 

Please bear in mind that:

This is a permanent-term contractor job opportunity with Medsien Inc. 
Candidates living outside of Istanbul city center will be automatically eliminated from the process. 
All interviews will be conducted in English and the candidates having less than advanced level of English will be directly eliminated from the process regardless of their technical skills and expertise.

Our Process 

We will review your application along with all the others we receive and pick the top profiles for a screening call. In many cases due to time constraints and our candidate volume, only the short-listed candidates are contacted but we do consider each application carefully. If you have been selected as a short-listed candidate, we will contact you for a short screening call to get to know you better. If you don't get a call, please don't be disappointed! We receive many applications for each role and must prioritize who we speak to.

Employment at Medsien is based solely on a person's merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, age, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.

Thank you for taking the time to apply for a position at Medsien! 

Please visit the below links for GDPR details:

https://www.medsien.com/legal/employee-candidate-information-notice

https://www.medsien.com/legal/employee-candidate-explicit-consent-statement

title: Consultant - Organisational Strategy
details:
About Us

Korn Ferry is a global organizational consulting firm. We help clients synchronize strategy and talent to drive superior performance. We work with organizations to design their structures, roles, and responsibilities. We help them hire the right people to bring their strategy to life. And we advise them on how to reward, develop, and motivate their people.

Our 10,000 colleagues serve clients in more than 50 countries. We offer five core solutions:

Organizational Strategy
Assessment and Succession
Talent Acquisition
Leadership Development
Total Rewards

Job Description

About Organizational Strategy

Technology. Customers. Markets. They are all changing faster than ever. And businesses are transforming to keep up or keep ahead. Auto brands are selling services, not just cars. Manufacturers are selling data, not just products. Some businesses are pushing into new territories, others are merging. No sector is immune.

Korn Ferryâ€™s Organizational Strategy team provides end to end support to organizations who want to transform their business. We help them translate their strategy into something they can operationalize, by aligning both the tangible elements of the organization - people, structure and process - and the intangible elements - motivations, relationships and culture. This enables us to anticipate and react to evolving markets, drive true behavioural and organizational change - and make it stick.

At Korn Ferry We Work With Leaders To First Clarify Their Strategy, Then Cascade The Results Into An Operating Model, Organizational Structure And Processes. We Leverage Industry-leading Tools And Methodologies And Work Collaboratively With Leadership To

Align leaders around a shared and compelling purpose.

Clarify the strategy so it's fit-for-purpose and can be implemented.

Develop an operating model that manages competing priorities and ensures that everything the business does adds value to the bottom line.

Design a detailed organizational structure that aligns with the operating model and focuses people on doing the right things.

Develop effective governance processes that help the organization work.

Purpose of the Position

To deliver organizational strategy, including operating model design, detailed organizational structure design and to be able to develop effective governance processes, as part of project teams, for a variety of clients and industries. At the Principal Levels, Consultants will be involved in more complex or custom solutions to drive real business value to the client.

Key Responsibilities

Help organizations to navigate and implement organizational change and identify opportunities for improvement through assessing organizational structures using analytical tools and techniques.

Identify, quantify and support delivery of the financial and non-financial benefits of organizational design, being able to manage small projects and/or a work-stream within a larger project.

May have more substantive conversations with client contacts at manager level and below to explain information provided, clarify requests for information, etc.

Begin to develop client network, proactively reaching out to clients and prospects to discuss issues and needs and forming productive relationships. May be the primary contact for small clients and/or projects.

Participate in sales and client planning activities at smaller organizations.

Support business development by contributing to new business proposals and presentations and taking a role in industry and account teams.

Identify trends, collate and distribute industry research/analysis as well as enhance your understanding of client and sector issues.

The Candidate

Experience And Professional Qualifications

Typically, a relevant first (Masterâ€™s) degree with several yearsâ€™ (2-5 years) relevant work experience in organizational design, preferably in professional services, transformation or other related role (e.g. internal consultant).

Experience working independently to apply organizational design methods and tools to address client needs.

Capable of drafting full project deliverables for review by a lead consultant.

Able to identify the steps required for a typical organizational design project and understand the interrelationship of different streams of work in a larger project.

Able to execute standard protocols and customize the approach when appropriate, with input and approval from subject matter experts in the firm.

Has developed and maintains a general knowledge and understanding of clients and industries to understand the basic drivers of business effectiveness and typical business models.

Skills And Competencies

Strong analytical and project management skills.

Excellent facilitation, communication and data analysis skills.

Ability to build excellent client relationships.

Ability to look at the bigger picture as well as have a keen eye for detail.

Creative and resolutive approach to problem solving.

Entrepreneurial spirit and curiosity to learn about new businesses, sector trends and solutions.

Fluency in PowerPoint and Excel. Experience of using organizational analytical tools (e.g. OrgVue, Dynaplan) is desired.

Internal Mobility at Korn Ferry

If you currently work for Korn Ferry or one of our affiliates, you must be eligible to apply for a different position within Korn Ferry to use the Careers Site. If you accept such a position, your benefits programs and Human Resources policies may change. Please consult with your HR contact for the new position concerning application eligibility, including any immigration/visa needs, benefit programs, and HR policies applicable to that position.

Korn Ferry is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

title: Business Support ATR-D
details:
This position requires excellence in administrative functions - the ideal candidate for this role can effectively manage a demanding workload under time constraints with a calm, confident, and positive attitude, the ability to work independently, and deal with ambiguity.

Excellent communications skills, the ability to prioritize effectively, and handle multiple time-critical tasks simultaneously are a must. Being detail-oriented and having consistent and timely follow-up will be essential for success in this role.

This role requires experience in multinational companies and an advanced level in English, calendar skills, operational excellence, and an effective use of data and business systems. 

Responsibilities

Responsibilities

Duties Include But Are Not Limited To

Provide administrative support to LT members, managing domestic and international travel scheduling end-to-end, ticketing via the designated travel agency and visa processes
Calendar management and meeting organizing
Booking meeting rooms inside the office when needed
Process managersâ€™ expense reports in a timely manner, as well as interim approve their Directsâ€™ expense reports
Support end-to-end logistics for events organized by the segment(s) they work with, team meetings and offsites, which includes meeting logistics (booking space and catering), and material preparation
Organizing customer - partner related events of the segment
Additional Team, Team Wellness and team activity projects as needed
Work closely and collaboratively with the other business administrators within Turkey, MEA and across Microsoft
Arranging flowers and donations for special occasions like birth, funeral, birthday, etc. In line with the requirements, via the company resources.
Providing support in hosting guest executives â€“ shuttles, agenda preparation, meeting arrangements, any relevant events â€“ by close follow-up with segment lead(s).
Procurement of goods and services using internal tools and support contract processes in relation to those â€“ Purchase orders
Budget management, including creating Purchase Orders, and tracking spend in partnership with the teamâ€™s Business Manager
Anticipate and remove administrative roadblocks and make timely decisions across the business group
Support creating PPT slides
Additional Team projects as needed
Provide general team support for ad hoc support requests

Qualifications

Please note that this position is designated exclusively for candidates registered as persons with disabilities (PWD). Proof of disability status will be required as part of the recruitment process.
Minimum 4+ years of demonstrated work experience supporting leaders in a fast-paced environment
Business level English skill with the experience of working as admin/secretary using English with high preference of experience of supporting English speaking executives
Strong planning, organizational, time management, and problem-solving skills
Highly effective communication ability, both written and verbal
Ability to react with appropriate urgency to situations and requests
Ability to build effective cross-group working relationships and work collaboratively with people at all levels of the organization
Proficiency with Microsoft productivity software including Outlook, all Office suite programs, SharePoint, One Note, Teams
Excellent skills in all aspects of planning, collaboration, analytical capabilities, and high level of attention to detail and proactive awareness
This description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this position. The actual duties, responsibilities, and qualifications may vary based on assignment.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. title: Senior Product Designer
details:
About the Role

Weâ€™re looking for a Senior Product Designer with deep expertise in design systems to join our product design team. In this role, youâ€™ll take ownership of building, maintaining, and scaling our design system and component library. You will work closely with product, engineering, and brand teams to ensure a consistent, efficient, and accessible experience across web and mobile platforms. Additionally, you will play a key role in shaping the overall product vision by balancing user needs with business goals.


Qualifications:

4+ years of experience in product design, preferably with a focus on design systems and UI architecture,
Advanced proficiency in Figma (components, variants, auto-layout, tokens, etc.),
Solid experience designing for mobile apps and responsive web platforms,
Hands-on experience in building or expanding design systems from scratch or scaling existing ones,
Strong collaboration skills with developers and ability to bridge the gap between design and code,
Excellent grasp of visual hierarchy, typography, color theory, and layout systems,
Ability to think user-first while understanding business constraints and priorities,
Strong communication and documentation skills,
A portfolio showcasing design system and product design work is required.


Responsibilities:

Design System & UI Standardization
Build, document, and maintain a robust design system and component library to ensure consistency across products,
Define design principles, component behaviors, naming conventions, guidelines, and accessibility standards,
Collaborate with engineering teams to ensure pixel-perfect, responsive, and accessible implementation of UI components,
Promote system thinking across product and design teams and drive adoption of the system,
Plan for scalability by extending the design system as new features, platforms, or products emerge.

Senior Product Design Ownership
Translate product goals and user needs into elegant, intuitive, and scalable user experiences,
Design user flows, interaction patterns, and wireframes that simplify complex problems,
Align design strategy with business priorities to influence product direction,
Justify design decisions using data, user insights, and business reasoning,
Ensure visual quality and consistency across all touchpoints.

Team Collaboration & Mentorship
Mentor other designers, share knowledge, and contribute to the teamâ€™s overall design maturity,
Actively participate in design critiques and give constructive feedback,.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams such as product managers, engineers, data analysts, and marketing specialists.


Nice to Have

Experience with implementing design systems in code or working alongside front-end teams (React, Flutter, etc.),
Previous experience in sports, betting, gaming, or digital entertainment platforms is a plus.

title: Mobile Application Development Lead
details:
Wingie Enuygun Group is Turkey's leading travel marketplace with more than 20 million visitors and 70 million page impressions each month. With its user-focused service, more than 500,000 travelers worldwide book their flights on Wingie Enuygun Group every month.

We invite you to have the opportunity to work in Wingie Enuygun Group's young and dynamic team.

We are looking for a Mobile Application Development Lead for Wingie Enuygun Group's growing Technology department. With this position, you will have the chance to take part in the team that has developed one of the most successful internet businesses in Turkey.

Requirements

What Makes You Special?

 5+ years of experience with React Native (experience with version 0.70+ is a must)
Proven experience in building production-level applications using TypeScript 
Strong expertise in Redux Toolkit and state management best practices
Ability to implement complex navigation structures using React Navigation (v6+) 
Experience integrating native code for both iOS and Android platforms
Proficiency in working with RESTful APIs and using Axios for data fetching


What Will You Do?

Develop highly-responsive, cross-platform mobile applications using React Native 
Understand and analyze user interactions to improve the mobile experience
Design and implement a scalable and maintainable mobile architecture, along with necessary API integrations
Build reusable components and shared libraries to speed up development
Convert UI/UX designs and wireframes into clean, high-quality code 
Optimize performance of the app across both iOS and Android devices, ensuring responsiveness and efficiency


Benefits

What do we offer?

The opportunity to work with the latest technologies and tools which serve the needs of millions of travelers worldwide,
The chance to witness firsthand how we have managed to become a rapidly scaling and now globalized e-commerce company in Turkey and to be a part of a culture that centers around data, productivity, and customer satisfaction,
Lifelong learning, development, and growth opportunities with ongoing training sessions, internal and external training programs, and free access to e-learning platforms such as Coursera, Udemy, Symfonycasts, Lynda, Edx, Oreilly,
Appointments with our nutritionist for you to take a step towards healthier lifestyle,
Gift Card so that you can unwind after a productive day by watching your favorite shows,
A comprehensive orientation program to get you acquainted with the Wingie Enuygun team and start contributing from the first day,
An office environment without a dress code,
Meal card for lunch and daily access to healthy snacks (Multinet),
Social club memberships (Hiking Club, Animal Protection Club, Basketball Club, Football Club, Volleyball Club, Chess Club, Game Club, Culture and Art Club),
Complementary health insurance (Anadolu Sigorta),
Life insurance (Axa),
Travel fee for the day you arrive at the office
Commuter benefits covering the number of days you come to the office,
Two big parties to celebrate your successes with your team,
Discounts on flight tickets and hotel reservations from Wingie Enuygun Group,
Carrefour Gift Card to contribute to grocery shopping once a year,
Marriage and birth gifts

title: Engineering Manager - Web
details:
Canonical is a leading provider of open-source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of globally distributed collaboration, with 1100+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder-led, profitable and growing.

We are hiring a Web Engineering Manager to work collaboratively with many teams and roles across the organisation including product managers and other engineering teams to deliver reliable, scalable and delightful user experiences for users of Canonical products.

As an Engineering Manager at Canonical, your primary responsibility is to the people you support: ensuring that they are growing as web engineers, doing valuable work, and generally having a great time at Canonical. As a lead for strong engineers, technical leadership and a solid background in web development is a must so that you're able to challenge and grow your team members. You will have the opportunity to influence the culture, facilitate technical delivery, and work with your team on strategy and execution.

Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.

The role entails

Demonstrate sound engineering principles by directly contributing to your team's goals
Estimate work, set goals, and meet them
Design and implement well-tested and documented software in Web technologies or Flutter.
Debug and fix issues encountered by your users
Participate in our engineering process through code and architectural reviews
Collaborate with community and colleagues on technical specifications
Contribute to technical documentation to make it the best of its kind
Seek improvements to engineering and operations practices
Deploy and operate services developed by the team
Contribute to the success of your product through technical advocacy

What we are looking for in you

You are knowledgeable and passionate about web and software development
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
An exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or STEM, or a compelling narrative about your alternative path
Drive and a track record of going above and beyond expectations
Well-organised, self-starting and able to deliver to schedule
Professional manner in interacting with colleagues, partners, and community
Experience designing and writing high-quality Web technologies
Experience with and passion for Typescript, React or Flutter
An eye for accessibility and performance
Professional written and spoken English
Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
Passion, thoughtfulness, and self-motivation
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Result-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments
Ability to travel twice a year, for company events for up to two weeks each

Nice-to-have skills

Experience with container tech such as LXD, Docker and Kubernetes
Experience building and maintaining a talented team
REST API design, development and governance
Performance engineering and security experience

What we offer colleagues

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.

Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Maternity and paternity leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long-haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal-opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background creates a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Part-time Software Development Engineer (Cloud)
details:
About the Program;

Our program is designed to complement the studies, helping the students gain valuable skills and experience within Siemens, build up a network by working at challenging software development projects and sharing thoughts and ideas among each other and with Siemens employees.

During the whole time a mentor will guide the student through the program, offering advice, feedback and support, to give our students the best start in the industry.

During the program participants will be challenged with:

 Designing, developing, and testing software for Siemensâ€™s products and platforms dedicated for industrial automation, industrial IoT, cloud and edge computing solutions.
 Working in a multi-site, multi-national and contemporary software development environment
 Producing high quality project deliverables
 Conforming to Siemens processes, quality standards, and guidelines

To apply for the Program, you need to;

 Willing to follow software engineering and/or test automation engineering career path.
 Good command of English.
 Minimum 2,5 days/week availability is expected (partly remote working).
 Eager to learn Industrial Automation domain know-how.
 Hands-on programming skills and knowledge in one of the programming languages (.Net, Python, Node.js, React) is a must .
 Knowledge of source control tools (e.g. Git, etc) is a plus.
 Studied on digital signal processing topic is a big plus.

What we offer:

We offer a completely new form of learning, letting the students build solutions to real problems and develop a deep insight into a career with us.

 You will start an international career by being responsible for designing, coding, testing, documenting, and supporting our software products.
 You will learn key skills like teamwork and project development as they work in global project teams â€“ making valuable friends and contacts in the process.
 You will get advice and guidance from mentors with a mix of on-site events, virtual training modules and guided reflection sessions.
 You will actively gain experience in agile working environment while being empowered by agile trainings.

Application Process:

 Screening & Assessments:

Stage 1) If you are among the candidates selected for the next phase, youâ€™ll be invited to video interview.

Stage 2) Technical Interview: Based on your qualifications, youâ€™ll be invited to technical interview where you will meet people from different projects.

Stage 3) P&O Interview: Based on our technical managerâ€™s evaluations, you will be invited to meet our People and Organization Team for competency-based Interview.

Selection:

If youâ€™re selected, you will be informed and offered a part-time position contract.

Individual benefits are adapted to meet local legal regulations, the requirements of different job profiles, locations, and individual preferences.

title: Assistant Restaurant Manager
details:
Company Description

"Why work for Accor?

We are far more than a worldwide leader. We welcome you as you are and you can find a job and brand that matches your personality. We support you to grow and learn every day, making sure that work brings purpose to your life, so that during your journey with us, you can continue to explore Accorâ€™s limitless possibilities.

By joining Accor, every chapter of your story is yours to write and together we can imagine tomorrow's hospitality. Discover the life that awaits you at Accor, visit https://careers.accor.com/

Do what you love, care for the world, dare to challenge the status quo! #BELIMITLESS"

As soon as you step inside The Grand Tarabya Managed by Accor, which holds a very special place in Istanbul's history, you will feel the charm of a 100-years-old past, the highest architectural and aesthetic standards, and the splendor inspired by the sparkle of the Bosphorus. From the 4.500 square meter spa area to the panoramic Bosphorus view of 29 residences and 248 rooms, from the magnificent 1.280 square meter ballroom to the restaurants and bars offering an unforgettable gastronomic adventure, The Grand Tarabya Managed by Accor, combines care, elegance, and comfort in every detail. With its doors opening to the Bosphorus, The Grand Tarabya Managed by Accor, will forever hold its place in your memory.

Job Description

At The Grand Tarabya Managed by Accor, exceptional service and flavors are the hallmarks of every dining experience. We invite you to develop your leadership strengths as an Assistant Restaurant Manager â€“ and let your passion for guest service drive consistent guest satisfaction, an engaged team and outstanding operating results.

Your Job Duties Include

Help lead the F&B Outlet team in all aspects of the department and ensure service standards are followed
Handle guest concerns and react quickly and professionally
Balance operational, administrative and Colleague needs
Maximize revenues by communicating regularly with the Food and Beverage teams to implement agreed upon strategies, practices and promotions
Supervise and support of employees while ensuring service standards are maintained
Help with recruit, train, manage, mentor, lead and develop your supervisors and colleagues
Have full knowledge of all Outlet menus
Other duties as assigned

Qualifications

Your Skills & Qualifications:

Must have 2 years previous experience as a Leader in Food & Beverage; preferably in a full service hotel or upscale restaurant
Diploma or Degree in Hospitality/Hotel Administration an asset
Strong interpersonal and problem-solving abilities with a service-focused personality
Flexibility to work various shifts, including early mornings, late nights, weekends, and holidays
The willingness to learn and be constantly challenged to grow with the restaurant team.
An appreciation for detail and a passion for guest service.
A professional and positive attitude in every aspect of the position.
Consistent punctuality and dedication.
A calm, polite and composed demeanor.

Additional Information

Your Team And Working Environment

We support you to grow and learn every day, making sure that work brings purpose to your life, so that during your journey with us, you can continue to explore Accorâ€™s limitless possibilities.

Note: Customization may be included for any specific local or legislative requirements, such as work permits.

Our Commitment To Diversity & Inclusion

We are an inclusive company and our ambition is to attract, recruit and promote diverse talent.

title: Backend Developer (Node.js / Remote)
details:
Join our team at Atolye15 and experience the freedom to work remotely from wherever you are. Once you are a part of us, you'll collaborate side by side with highly talented and experienced product developers, participate in significant global projects that promise international growth, employ the latest cutting-edge technologies, and enjoy the journey with your new close-knit teammates.

Get a clearer idea of how we approach the projects we develop from the podcast here, and you can have a glance at our Instagram profile.

Job Requirements: 

Fluency in English is a must since we actively use it in our day-to-day work, including retrospectives and client demos.
3+ years of software development experience with in-depth knowledge of Node.js.
Proficient in JavaScript and TypeScript, with experience in frameworks like NestJS.
Familiarity with software testing techniques.
Focus on sustainable development practices.
Understanding of functional and object-oriented programming principles.
Experience with containerized environments such as Kubernetes.
Proficiency in creating advanced GraphQL servers.
Focus on sustainable development practices.
Experience in caching for high-traffic, public-facing websites.

Great If You Have: 

Experience with GraphQL gateways, gRPC, OpenTelemetry, Microservices, feature flags, and trunk-based development.
Familiarity with TDD, BDD, and DDD.
Experience with cloud ecosystems such as AWS or Azure.
Familiarity with monorepos is also beneficial.
Passion for developing and maintaining libraries for public use or across teams.
 A backend-focused mindset with an appreciation for product and frontend impact â€” you think beyond endpoints and consider how your work shapes the overall user experience.
Comfort collaborating across the stack and understanding how backend choices impact the end-user experience.

What Sets You Apart:

Passion for creating scalable and sustainable code, focusing on abstraction, clean architecture, and a collaborative development process.
If you're passionate about working in a dynamic, collaborative, and agile team where your ideas are valued and can drive meaningful change.
If you believe in the importance of clear, concise, and practical documentation to improve team efficiency and ensure smooth project development.
If you enjoy working in a development process that involves active participation in daily stand-ups, PR reviews, and retrospectives, while contributing to continuous improvement and teamwork.
If you feel comfortable working with strict linting rules as part of your workflow.
If you believe in not just getting things done, but also ensuring quality and reliability by writing tests, all while maintaining this mindset throughout the product development process.
If you trust your collaboration skills and enjoy working with cross-functional teams to identify and prioritize customer requirements and feedback.
If you see yourself as a team player, always reliable, responsible, and highly motivated.
Always eager to learn, open to self-improvement, and driven by a desire to discover something new every day.

Tools & Tech Stack 

We prioritize the sustainability, reliability, and purity of our code, focusing on abstractions like Separation of Concerns, layered architecture, and IoC, rather than specific technology names.

More Reasons to Become One of Us!
ğŸ  Fully Remote Team: No office requirements, no commutes. Just the freedom to work from wherever you call home.
ğŸŒ Flexible Workplace: Work from home, a co-working space, or wherever your travels take you. You can even drop by our Izmir office.
ğŸ’° USD-Based Salary: Competitive salaries with performance-based raises, all paid in USD.
ğŸ¯ Bonus System: Rewards for referrals, creating content, and giving presentations.
ğŸ“š Self-Development Fund: Dedicated budget to grow your skills, whether itâ€™s for work or a personal passion.
ğŸ’ Ultimate Welcome Kit: Swag to wear with pride, plus a few extras to make it even more special.
ğŸ’» Top-Quality Equipment: Latest MacBook Pro and all the accessories you need to do your best work.
ğŸ¥ Private Healthcare: Premium medical package to keep you feeling your best.
ğŸŒ´ Epic Team Retreats: Happy people vacationing together, no awkward silences at all. Check out our YouTube!

title: Backend Developer / Node.js
details:
We are seeking a Backend Developer for our sector-leading client in the technology industry.

Requirements

At least 2 years of experience in Node.JS backend development,
A strong follower of Stackoverflow, contributing to the community is a plus,
We look for production experience in microservices architecture,
Command Redis and PubSub RabbitMQ,
Strong understanding of database systems and a supporter of PostgreSQL,
Can talk non-stop with developers about â€œgit rebase vs git mergeâ€,
An excellent understanding of SDLC focused on continuous releases,
We donâ€™t even mention Docker, love to talk about Kubernetes,
Working knowledge of architectures and design patterns,
Experience working in agile teams, familiarity with the mindset and terminology,
Ability to communicate with people ;)


Responsibilities

Continuous Code Refactoring,
Align with product roadmap developing efficient and reliable code,
Automate development process,
Support the entire application lifecycle,
Troubleshoot and debug to optimize performance,
Collaborate with the Product development team to plan new features,
Ensure new and legacy applications meet quality standards,
Stay up-to-date with new technology trends.
